reviews.text: Arrival at Marco Polo airport - purchase a ticket on the ATVO airport bus for 3 Euro. The bus will leave you off at Piazzale Roma - the main bus terminus. Then it is just a short walk across the bridge over the Grand Canal, past the train station, and make a left down a narrow passageway, and the hotel is on the left. Don't drag a lot of luggage with you anywhere in Venice. You really don't need that much "stuff."
reviews.title: Perfect location, abundant breakfast spread

reviews.text: This hotel is just like the pictures and close to bus and train station. good breakfast. Small rooms but adequate (no tea making facilitie) ate at Brek in the eveningswhich is a couple of doors away .good solid cafe food good prices. Walked most of the city felt very safe.Great atmosphere in the student area for a drink in the evening Had a wonderful time Great time of year to visit this place, warming your hands on mulled wine by the grand canal
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of January. The hotel had been recommended by a friend who stayed there last year. Great recommendation which I'd pass on to anyone. The hotel is located up a small street, 100 metres from the Grand Canal - at the Ponte degli Scalzi. Another 50 metres or so brings you to the main Railway Station, and a couple of hundred more to the Piazzale roma bus terminus (where the Airport bus arrives). Most of the water buses stop near the Ponte. The hotel is a former convent, which has been extensively refurbished recently. Just one minor drawback - there is no lift, so if you have mobility problems, ask for a ground floor room. There is a nice garden, which would be lovely in warmer weather.
reviews.title: good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly. Good buffet breakfast in the morning - best I've had in Italy!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The front desk staff are the most helpful staff ever. They will do anything for you - call to see if something is open, help you navigate via maps, answer e-mails before you arrive (they answered all of my questions promptly and efficiently). The place was an abbey (that is what Abbazia means) and the pulpit in the lounge provides great ambience. I had many requests regarding rooms and the staff managed to meet them all!!! We stayed there December 17 for 4 nights which is a slow time of year. They gave our family 2 rooms on the second floor (there are no elevators) that were both behind an outside door so we could shut that and get between our 2 rooms very efficiently. The rooms had burgundy silk walls - you felt like you were in Italy! We had a great tiled shower with doors - my one suggestion to the staff is to hang a shower basket from the door for guests to put soap and shampoo in (not a big deal but easier for use). The beds are nice and long but a bit hard - the way it seems Italians like their beds. The breakfast was wonderful with boiled eggs, juice, hot chocolate, various coffees, croissonts, buns, ham, meat, cheese, yogurt, cereal, toast, fruit - a full selection. Everything was tasty and good. The location was right around the corner from the train station and easy to wheel luggage between there and the hotel (they even tell you where to turn that avoids the steps). Coming from the airport we took the Aliguana boat because we thought a boat ride would be scenic but I recommend the land bus (I think it's the ACTV - if you e-mail them they will send you directions from the drop-off to the hotel which you need because it is easy to get lost in Venice). The bus is 5 euro a person and the Aliguana is 15 euro/person and the bus is quicker and picked up right outside the airport whereas you have to walk quite a way at the airport to catch the boats. It's a nice walk to St. Mark's (maybe 25 minutes, I'm a slow walker) past lots of shopping so it's fun to stop and look. I recommend going in the off-season because rates are cheaper and you can even bargain on a gondola ride for your family (I think we paid about 80 euro for a 50 minute ride for the 4 of us that went all around the grand canal, under the Rialto bridge and in side canals). The best is to bargain to 60 euro and tell them you will give him a good tip if you like the ride - he even sang and whistled). The weather was cool and we wore 2 layers of light jackets so we could take one off when it warmed up. We took the train for a day trip to Verona and it worked well . We took the local trains which stop more but are cheap - but know that you have to validate your ticket at a machine before getting on the train for the local/regional trains - or you can get a huge fine. I highly recommend the Hotel Abbazzia!
reviews.title: Best staff ever!!!

Best location and value in Venice
reviews.text: A note on the staff. We stayed here after a cruise that arrived in Venice at 6 AM. We had to leave the ship by 8, so we made it to Abbazia sometime before 9. Since we arrived well before check-in, the staff allowed us to drop our bags at the desk and they gave us access to the breakfast room and the rest rooms. We had some coffee and took a quick trip out to check out our surroundings. We were back by 10:30, and they had our room ready for us. The desk also provided some great dining recommendations as well as some tips to get around the city. They also mentioned that the hotel runs a free service to Murano (we didn't use it though). Apparently, the hotel's owner also has a shop there in case you are interested.

While it is 1 minute from the chaos of the Grand Canal, railway staion and the multitudes it is a quiet, calm oasis in a converted convent. The room was perfect. Roomy by european standards and it had an up to date bathroom. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. The service was firstclass. We received accurate recomendations about restaurants. By taking Mathews advice we achieved the semingly impossible and did not get lost!

In winter we could not benefit at full of the interior garden of the hotel, however in warm weather this should be also be a special pleasure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Abbazia is a gem of a hotel that is easy to get to and for getting to the cruise terminal. We took train from Florence and it literaaly was 3 minutes out of the Venice train station to the hotel door. A very easy stroll even with suitcases. The hotel is very accomodating and the front desk personnel very helpful. The hotel is beautiful inside and we had a very large room on the ground floor overlooking the courtyard garden. The breakfast was plentiful with some very nice baked goods and a nice array of typical European breakfast items. We walked from the hotel over the new bridge to the Plaza Roma and caught the people mover to our cruise ship. You can also catch a vaporetta at the train station to the Plaza Roma stop with your luggage if you have too much to carry. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice as it has easy access to walk the rest of the town or take the vaporettas from in front of the train station.
reviews.title: Most Beautiful City in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Abbazia in November of 2011 for 3 nights. The hotel room was the largest room I have ever stayed in and it was extremely clean. Bathroom was equally as large. The front desk was extremely helpful. Breakfast was adequate, maybe a little crowded depending on the time but, who cares, you are in Venice! Lots of atmosphere in the hotel and also surrounding it. Steps from the train station, steps from lots of shopping and most important steps from the vaporettas. Venice has a very sophisticated system of water transportation that makes getting around a snap. Will definitely come back and will definitely choose Hotel Abbazia again. A very good value. Linda Garbaccio
reviews.title: Lovely courtyard and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coming from Basel in Switzerland by train, we reached Venice's train station. It was the middle of August and the city was very crowded and incredibly hot, with people were going everywhere. It was very pleasant to be located at such short distance from the main station. The exterior or the building is not very impressive, but the interior areas are very interesting. The rooms were wide and the courtyard area is lovely, a good start for the day with the breakfast offered by them. Staff were very helpful and friendly - a good hand when going upstairs with the suitcases, since the is no elevator. People with some difficulty in mobility might want to make sure they keep one of the rooms on the ground floor. The breakfast is not fabulous but good, solid. We had problems with the airconditioning system that did not work properly in our room. In no time, the hotel staff managed to get us in another room, even more modern than the one we previously had. Again, all great in there. The staff was also helpful in getting us a good price for the transfer to the airport, as we were 6 women with quite some luggage! Definitely a place I would recommend, easy to move around the city in the Vaporettos, friendly staff and good rooms!
reviews.title: A real gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on 24th and 25th Feb 2011. The hotel is ideally located just minutes away from the Santa Lucia Train Station and Ferrovia Water Taxi Station. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and cooperative and never showed any disappointment with our requests. The hotel has a very good spacious sitting area for guests. The room was of pretty decent size - I had actually expected that it would be very small but it was very spacious. We were able to accomodate our three suitcases easily. The breakfast served was pretty much standard but decent. Though they did not serve omelettes, baked beans or hashbrownies. Maybe I was expecting too much. The staff guided us on the places of tourist interest and how to take the water taxi that is the means of transport in Venice. Overall our stay was very comfortable and I would certainnly stay at this hotel again if I visit Venice in future. I also strongly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have good value for money and does not want to splurge money on five star amenities which they may or may not use. Thanks to Abazzzia hotel for making our stay comfortable
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Abbazia is a converted abbey within steps of the train station. It is down a narrow alleyway, and so has the feeling of great privacy. The front desk staff is incredibly helpful, but also incredibly funny. Our interaction with them made the hotel feel very personal, and earned our loyalty. Besides the pleasant and memorable desk service, there are two other great features of this hotel. One is the expansive, comfortable livingroom where one can go to read a book, meet up with the rest of one's party or have a cup of tea or a cocktail in the afternoon. It is lightly scented with a delicious incense that gives meaning to the term "aroma therapy." The other is the sun-bathed garden. After a few days of typical spring rain, we couldn't resist sitting out there, absorbing the warmth and feeling far from the crowds of the Venice streets -- just outside the garden walls. We were two moms traveling with a total of 3 kids. We took a double and a quad (the triple being full). Our room (the quad) was clean and plenty spacious with a big bathroom and tub. The included breakfast, which was in the little dining room, offered plenty of selections for all tastes. The hotel's proximity to the train station enabled us to get in and out of Venice with relative ease, especially in the pouring rain. For those who have not traveled to Venice, this part of the island is just as charming and picturesque and full of shops and restaurants as those areas around San Marco Square.
reviews.title: A great find!

likes.liked: — During the rainy afternoons, the hotel felt like a comfortable refuge.
likes.disliked: — The hotel does not have an elevator, so it is not good for people with a lot of luggage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to the train station and Piazzale Roma, but you don't experience the business normally associated with that type of location. The Abbazia is tucked away down a little side street. The lounge area is very pretty and oddly enough we noted that this hotel smells wonderful - due to the oil infusers placed around the hotel. The rooms are small - in Venice style - but pretty with fantastic bathrooms. Due to its size, Venice is pretty much within walking distance of everything, so we had no problem exploring the city from the Abbazia. We'd recommend the hotel to all couples - the inner courtyard view was beautiful and you wake to the peaceful sounds of birds chirping in the trees.
reviews.title: Loved the Abbazia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in Hotel Abbazia. We booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and weren’t disappointed. The Hotel is a quiet lane just 150m from Venice Santa Lucia train station. The rooms were of good size and well decorated, but we didn’t like the room colour as it looked a bit dull, apart from that it was well maintained room. The entire hotel is well decorated and we really liked the courtyard. The location of the Hotel is perfect, close to the train station (probably an easier location to find your way back even if you’re lost in the small alleys of Venice) and is about 20 minutes walk from St. Mark’s square. The early morning bells from the close by monastery added to a nice touch to our trip. The hotel serves a good breakfast and there are also some decent restaurants around the place. Overall a good place to stay in Venice, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Good Place
Wonderful hotel with great character
reviews.text: This converted monastery provided us with the a central base with which to visit Venice. Looks quite tatty from the outside, but is beautiful inside with material clad walls in our bedroom overlooking the garden. Yes, we were right underneath the bell tower but somehow the bells were charming and just added to our holiday. Service was really good and breakfast excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Vivaldi concert, in St Marks Square,although only an hour long is worth seeing. Be aware that the campanile is very expensive at 8euros each so unless you really want that view, best avoided. The basilica is free to go into but if you join the queue to the right, you'll got into the treasury where you have to pay 3 euros each. Doesn't sound that much, but unless you're into bits of bone in ornate glass jars you'll not really feel the benefit. Venice at night is wonderful. Get the front seat on the vaparetto, and ride down the grand canal.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really lovely hotel, a hidden gem. Perfect location for those arriving by train, and only a short vaporetto ride to all the main sites, we had a wonderful honeymoon stay here. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and large by Venetian standards, and it was like a little oasis of calm in the sometimes-hectic Venice. The whole place was very clean, the breakfast was ample and the garden was pretty.
reviews.title: An absolute gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Locally, we recommend the Restaurant Poveledo, which is about 50 yards away from the hotel (hotel staff will give you directions). Excellent food on a pretty canalside terrace.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish we could go back right now!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We really enjoyed this hotel - the staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good, and the rooms were very comfortable and oozing style and history. The location was very good for us, close to the railway station so it was easy to get our luggage there, close to a vaporetto stop, and close to both a busy shopping and cafe area but also the quieter backwaters of Cannaregio and Santa Croce (and the hotel itself is off the main street, very peaceful). We could easily walk to the other areas of Venice. After we checked out the staff were happy to keep our luggage for us until the evening, and to let us use the lounge area and facilities during the day.

Breakfast was generous and varied and staff were keen to offer advice and help with any questions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is EXCELLENT!! Found it on Tripadvisor and after reading the reviews decided to stay here, and I'm so glad we did. The staff were so friendly, welcoming and helpful, the hotel was spotless and the rooms comfy and clean. The breakfast was fantastic, plenty to chose from...cereal, toast, croissants, yoghurt and fresh fruit. The hotel itself was so easy to find, being only five minutes walk from the Piazza Roma bus station. We would like to return to Venice soon and I will definetely be returning to the Hotel Abbazia, I wouldn't need to look at any other hotels as I really enjoyed my short break here!! Besides we would like to go back and see Matteo...funny guy!!
reviews.title: Fabulous.
